head.title: MONEY FOR LIBRARIES, STREETS AND HOMES

hedline.hl1: MONEY FOR LIBRARIES, STREETS AND HOMES

abstract.p: Westchester County receives $6.6 million from federal government and awards about $5.1 million of it for variety of community projects (S)

block.p: Westchester County has received $6.6 million from the federal government and has awarded about $5.1 million of it for community projects. Part of the remainder will go for repairs or removing health hazards at the homes of low-income residents. Municipal projects include $500,000 for street improvements in Mamaroneck, $450,000 for construction of a senior center in Port Chester, $130,000 for public housing in Greenburgh, $150,000 for playground renovation at the Ossining Children's Center and $70,000 to expand the children's library in Peekskill.

Westchester County has received $6.6 million from the federal government and has awarded about $5.1 million of it for community projects. Part of the remainder will go for repairs or removing health hazards at the homes of low-income residents. Municipal projects include $500,000 for street improvements in Mamaroneck, $450,000 for construction of a senior center in Port Chester, $130,000 for public housing in Greenburgh, $150,000 for playground renovation at the Ossining Children's Center and $70,000 to expand the children's library in Peekskill.
